title: Corrections & Amplifications
description: Corrections & Amplifications for the edition of Aug. 3, 2023

title: State Department Orders Partial Evacuation of U.S. Embassy in Niger
description: The U.S. is the latest Western country to take the action following a coup last week.

title: Brazil's Central Bank Cuts Selic to 13.25%
description: Brazil’s central bank cut its benchmark interest rate by half a percentage point, the first change to the rate in a year, and said it could be the first of a series of cuts meant to substantially reduce one of the world’s highest interest rates.

title: Vodka Vaults and Human Centerpieces: Real-Estate Pros Dish on Over-the-Top Open Houses
description: One salesperson served a three-course, sit-down dinner at a waterfront listing in New York.

title: For Pope's Visit, 150 Confessionals, No Waiting
description: People confess their sins in booths built by prisoners in Reconciliation Park in Lisbon for Pope Francis’s visit for the Catholic Church’s first World Youth Day festival since the pandemic. More than 1 million are expected to attend. Photo: Violeta Santos Moura/Reuters

title: Vivek Ramaswamy Dives Into Swamp Land

description: Will a new Justice recuse herself in a legislative redistricting case she has clearly prejudged?

description: This coastal California hamlet looks like the place Cinderella would get her glass slipper repaired

description: Monopolists try to roll back school choice in Nevada and Nebraska.

title: Bankrupt Manhattan Hotel Owner Should Pay Default Interest, Judge Rules
description: A bankrupt Holiday Inn in Manhattan can’t use chapter 11 to maintain its low-rate mortgage without paying penalty interest linked to its default, a judge ruled in a setback for borrowers seeking to hold on to more affordable loans as interest rates rise.

title: Why Warehouse Rents Keep Going Up While Demand Is Dropping
description: Industrial asking rents hit a record high last quarter even as companies leased less space.
